intro: Proselias incanus, commonly known as the white-flowered broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
